pullRequest.title: [#1509] Fix InjectionExtension for nested test classes
pullRequest.bodyText:
The functional change was implemented/suggested by Christian Dietrich.
See https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=563136
Current restriction is, that multiple @InjectWidth (1 on outer, 1 on
inner class) will not work. Only one is allowed.
Signed-off-by: Frank Benoit frank.rene.benoit@gmail.com

nodes.bodyText:
@kthoms @szarnekow this is the algorithm i proposed in the bugzilla.
what do you think?
Please add a small note about the injection into @Nested objects to the JavaDoc
This should be {@link Nested nested} test classes - could be, that the JavaDoc validation will fail if we do it like is is done right now.

Add . at the end of the sentence.

commit.message:
[#1509] Fix InjectionExtension for nested test classes

The functional change was implemented/suggested by Christian Dietrich.
See https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=563136
Current restriction is, that multiple @InjectWidth (1 on outer, 1 on
inner class) will not work. Only one is allowed.

Signed-off-by: Frank Benoit <frank.rene.benoit@gmail.com>
